RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EBONY EYES away well and tracked the dueling leaders in the run down the backside while racing just out from the rail, commenced her bid three wide through the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the drive to take command in deep stretch and draw clear late. B C CHU CHU pressed the pace from the outside of MS. STANFORD in the run down the backstretch, continued to battle for the lead two wide into the final turn, was no match for the winner late, but battled gamely two wide in the drive to hold the place. MS. STANFORD away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, drifted off the rail leaving the turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to just miss the place. STILETTOS ONLY stalked the early pace while racing racing three out from the rail entering the backstretch, continued four wide into the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. ANZAC BAY steadied through the stretch the first time when put in tight quarters at the rail, advanced into a stalking trip from along the inside entering the backside, advanced from along the rail midway to the final turn, rallied from just off the rail through the final turn, angled to the rail entering the lane, was put in tight quarters again soon after entering the lane, and appeared to clip heels with MS. STANFORD, and failed to regain her momentum. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of ANZAC BAY lodged a claim of foul against the rider of MS. STANFORD for alleged interference entering the lane. After review the claim of foul was upheld, and MS. STANFORD was disquallified from third and placed fifth.

ENTRY.NAME: Anzac Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early, stalked rail, rallied inside, checked 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Ebony Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: B C Chu Chu
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Ms. Stanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Stilettos Only
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO $5,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED AT THE 2023 MEET AND HAVE NOT FINISHED 1ST, 2ND OR 3RD AT THE CURRENT MEET. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. (Horse s that win this condition are no longer eligible for this condition while all other starters in this condition remain eligible.)(Winning this race will not be considered in eligibility in any other condition maidens excluded). British Columbia Bred Claimi ng Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACE DEUCE away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of TIMELESS SHRUG entering the stretch the first time, continued his battle with that mare in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, opened a clear advantage midway through the turn, and was never seriously threatened late. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground along the inside, maintained a striking position in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, tipped three wide entering the lane, and closed willingly in deep stretch to get up for the place. TIMELESS SHRUG broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, continued to set a pressured pace from the inside of ACE DEUCE in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished from just off the rail in the drive to garner a share. VALUE MAX away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued three wide into the final turn, but was outfinished in the drive while racing two out from the rail. BODEGA unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, and failed to respond over the final furlong when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied rail, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Ace Deuce
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Value Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER ARROW broke sharply and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained a striking trip in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, tipped four wide leaving the turn, and engulfed the leaders in mid stretch under confident handling. DRILL BABY DRILL away well and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, battled for the lead through the turn, was no match for the winner late, but finished evenly two wide in the drive to hold the place. STRIKING VALUE raced to the lead from along the rail midway through the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken in mid stretch and finished from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. PEACEHAVEN away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, rallied three wide into the final turn, but was outfinished over the final furlong. LIL'MISS INTAGLIO was off a step slow and trailed the field into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside while maintaining a striking position, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 w, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w

ENTRY.NAME: Lil'miss Intaglio
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Peacehaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 4w

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $8,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of CROWN COUNCIL in the run down the backside, rallied along the rail entering the final turn, and got the better of her pace rival late to prevail. CROWN COUNCIL ducked in at the start, but moved up from along the rail approaching the first turn, before having to steady when put in tight quarters, pressed the leader two wide through the stretch the first time, continued to pressured the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and finished gamely one out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. SHESBOURBONONICE broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the dueling leader while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon. CAIRO CRUSADER unhurried early while trailing the field into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Crown Council
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in start, steadied 1st turn, dueled 2w, rallied 2w,

ENTRY.NAME: Shesbourbononice
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied rail, closed inside, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Cairo Crusader
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSE OF TEXAS broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside, continued to show the way while saving ground at the rail entering the final turn, and drew clear in the drive under confident handling. ISLAND LIVING away alertly and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, mounted her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to get the place. TOBESUNNY stalked the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed two out from the rail in the drive to just miss the place. VISENYA away well and tracked the leader in the run down the backside while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing at the rail. PROUD CAUSE unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the first turn, was always well back and was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Island Living
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Visenya
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Cause
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Rose of Texas
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLAROO away alertly and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing three out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and continued three wide in the drive to be up in time. LASTING LIGHT tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rushed up from along the inside midway to the final turn to challenge for the lead entering the turn, battled for the lead through the turn, and finished from along the rail in he drive to just miss. ICE BREAKER settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and found her best stride late while finishing five wide in the drive to get up for a share. AMANDA settled off the early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backside, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished with late interest four wide in the drive. ARIKARA away well and raced to the lead entering the first turn while racing out from the rail, set a pressured pace into the backstretch, rallied two wide into the final turn, entering the lane two wide from between rivals. but faded in deep stretch. ZETAMARIE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, commenced her bid four wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ANAAMY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, saved ground entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. DON'TPASSTHEPEPPER broke sharply and pressed the pace from the outside of ARIKARA entering the backstretch, forced the issue from the outside of that rival to the final turn, before weakening.

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Don'tpassthepepper
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Anaamy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Zetamarie
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Bellaroo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 4w, rallied 3w, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Amanda
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lasting Light
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 11 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 11 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances) BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO PEOPLE broke inwards while bumping with HOAX in the opening strides and trailed the field into the backstretch, commenced her bid four wide entering the final turn, and finished best of all five wide in the drive to get up in time. CHI CHI'S SONG settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide from between rivals through the final turn, and closed with a rush from along the rail in the drive to just miss. ALOBRAH broke sharply and cleared to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage in the run down the backside, saved ground through the final turn, and just failed to last. LICORICE away alertly and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch, mounted her bid smartly two wide through the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to just miss. I'M ALL SHOOK UP away well and tracked the pacesetter in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. HOAX was bumped solidly in the opening strides, but worked her way into a stalking trip from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, steadied sharply when put in tight quarters at the rail nearing the final turn, and was unable to regain her momentum. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of HOAX lodged a claim of foul against the rider of I'M ALL SHOOK UP nearing the final turn. After review the claim of foul was upheld and I'M ALL SHOOK UP was disqualified from fifth and placed sixth.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-I'm All Shook Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Hoax
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked rail, steadied 5/16, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: No People
ENTRY.OWNER: Bulldog Bros Racing and LeMasurier Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inwards, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Chi Chi's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Alobrah
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, gave way grudgingly
